content.detailedDescription: While vacuuming car at a car wash in pleasanton, i looked up (why i don't know)to the sky and observed a white spherical object (aspirin size, maybe 1000 ft +/- (not good at aerial distance).  the object was absolutely stationery for about 2 minutes in one position then moved laterally, somewhat slowly about 3 inches left if you held up a ruler to the sky (again, not good with distances).  it stayed stationary again for about 1-2 minutes but i had to get going but when i completed my car vacuuming (about 5 mins later) the object was gone.  the object was somewhat overhead, to the west.
content.summary: White spherical object observed around 9:40am in clear sky, no surrounding craft

content.detailedDescription: We were driving on filmore street when i saw lights in the sky out of my passenger window.  i asked my husband what the lights were and he at first thought they was a tower.  i said no, they are moving and the ones in front are crossing over each other.  we then turned into a school parking lot to observe them stopped in our car.  we watched them for about 20 minutes.  there were about 100 of them at first and as they ascended into the sky they just disappeared out of view.  then more would appear from what looked like a field area about a mile away.  at one time 3 of them formed a straight line and then moved on.  then several of them formed a right angle arrow type formation and then moved on.  we left the school parking lot and drove to lake michigan dr. and turned east and drove approximately a mile and then turned south on a dirt road to see if we could see where they were coming from but by that time all of them had disappeared into the heaven and no more were ascending. we have never experienced anything like this in our life. i am 62 years old and my husband is 63 years old.  we drove home thinking maybe there would be something about this on the 11:00 news but there was not.  so far we haven't talked with anyone who saw these but us.  i am curious to find out if anyone else saw what we saw.
content.summary: Yellow/red orbs, hundreds of them hovering up and then disappearing into the heavens

content.detailedDescription:
I was taking pictures of the sunrise on sept. 7, at about 7 am, taking several shots due to the changing colors of the clouds.  the fourth picture had what appeared at first glance to be a smear or something.  i took another shot of the sunrise then went into the house.   later i looked at the pictures and discovered the "smear" was actually a white object, quite bright, with a tail that came down out of the clouds, showing that the object swooped to the south. i did not see this when taking the picture, or before or after taking the picture.   it appeared on the digital screen only.   when i enlarged the photo to show more detail, the object seems to have gone through the clouds when it turned to the south.   the trail has lines in it that look like it is some kind of exhaust, coming out of the back of the object.  i did not see or hear anything.  my husband and i have seen some odd things in the sky before, but we have no idea how this picture came to be.   

i am not very computer savvy, so i hope you get the picture attached.  i also attached a picture that i took a minute or so after.
content.summary: Oval, very large, bright white with no other markings, trail following from clouds, visible on digital camera only

content.detailedDescription:
In the darkness of the country it is easy to see abnormal lights. this light put off the same illumination as the moon which was full at  the time. it was just hovering in btween airplane tracfiic andthe clouds. it actually became transparent during passing of the aircraft.
 i marked its place in te air using landscape and went into the house.Ten minutes later i came bac and it had move up and over but not far. i watched for maybe 25 more minutes then all of a sudden it jus zipped off, as if it were slung from a sling shot . thats wen i realized it was  what i thought it was an alien drone.
content.shape: Circle,   Cylinder,   Disc,   Oval,   Sphere,   Star-like
content.summary: I noticed a bright light, watch it for a while ,went inside came bac it had moved .I watched for another 15 minutes until it asended

content.detailedDescription: I was half sleep in my bed when i felt a presence in my room . i turned very quickly to my right when i saw a small humanoid beside me for 2 or 3 seconds. i saw a definite shape and a hand with no digits on my shoulder. i just saw a feature-less humanoid figure . the height was about 4 feet but was not solid but sort of translucent and went out of my sight like a star trek transporter would do. it seem phased or not in my space-time or inter-dimensional. i have had enough strange happenings( missing time, lights being turned off when i wake) to know this was just part of it and real. i immediately got up and sat on my bed for 15 minutes wondering what i saw.
content.summary: Saw an entity near my bed touching my shoulder

content.detailedDescription: We were getting ready to close up the house for the evening and looked out our front picture window to witness these cylindrically-shaped, vertical self-contained flame/fireball objects slowly traveling from a south-west to a north-east direction in a straight line just above the treetops. they appeared to look like big vertical hot air balloon flames only without the balloon, basket or accompanying noise.  they were travelling in groups and/or triangular formations as well as singularly...All in the same path together, one right after the other. we were shocked and confused because we couldn't figure out what they could be...There is no physical, logical, atmospherical, meteorological or military explanation that we're able to conjer up. we ran in and grabbed our brand-new camcorder to try to capture as much as we could on video. the best perspective we were able to capture was the one we got showing the three of these independent, non-connected cylindrically-shaped balls of flames travelling together in a triangular-shaped formation. we watched them slowly travel away from us and then gradually just fade away into the clear night sky. unfortunately, we haven't owned our camcorder long enough to get a really great shot for posterity as you can tell from our photo date saying "sept. 12, 2011" when it actually was the evening of september 11th. we are in complete and total awe!
content.summary: Multiple straight-line cylindrical-shaped, vertical flames traveling either in formation or individually

content.detailedDescription: at around 11:27 pm , nw of grand rapids mi. my buddy rich and i were on our weekly ufo hunt and turned our heads toward the big dipper because a light that hadn't been there seconds before caught our attention. it was very bright and we watched it for about 7-9 seconds, then it just disappeared. it had just entered the bowl of the big dipper, moving slowly and just sort of faded out of existence. this has been the common theme to our sightings, bright object, no sound, no blinking lights, then it just fades out. tonight was by far the most intense, i think due in part to how bright it was and it's sudden appearance. anyone seeing anything similar?? sorry, no pictures.
content.summary: Lights that fade out

content.detailedDescription:
I was letting the dog out before going to bed.
i walked outside to see the full moon. i gazed around after seeing the moon and noticed a object in the sky to the west of my house and in the opposite direction of the moon. the angle was about 30 degrees to the west.
the object was stationary in the sky. the altitude was about 2000 ft. all i could make out was flashing / blinking colored lights. the colors were: red, white, green and blue. all blinking randomly and changing position. i thought i would have time, so i retrieved my binoculars. these helped resolve the lights better. however, i couldn't see an object / main body. 
when i went to retrieve the binoculars i had my wife come see the lights as well. 
after looking at the lights for 10-20 minutes we went to bed.
the next morning i wrote this report.
content.summary: Blinking lights in the night sky

content.detailedDescription: I was driving home from work and the orange ball of light was hovering very low on the horizon over the tree line. it did not move or blink or make any noise. i am reporting this sighting not because it's the most spectacular but because it's the most recent. i took notice of it because i've seen these before. the first time i saw the orange ball was while i was in high school and living in peru maine( best guess fall of 98). i was sitting on the couch looking south at an orange ball that looked like it was hovering over the ridge line but at that distance i couldn't be sure what i was looking at so i was trying to figure out if i was looking at a star and i noticed a second one a ways down the ridge so i kept looking for about 15 minutes. then the ball started to move in a straight line along the ridge. of in the distance a jet came into view. and started chasing the orange ball. so i ran out the back door so i could continue watching. the orange ball made a right angle turn across the back yard and the jet persued it until they were out of sight. the jet was low enough so even though it was dark out you could very clearly see it was a jet about the length of 2 quarters and yet the only feature i could see of the other object was that it was a glowing orange ball. i looked back to where the other ball of light was and it took off straight up and disappeared into the atmosphere.  i have seen this orange ball off and on for years. on my way to work about 7 years later driving to work in the late fall at about 3 in the morning. an orange ball of light about the size of a moving truck was shadowing my movments downs the river of route 2. i turned and looked away and it had disappeared. i descided to report this becuase i have just watched the fayetteville case on ufo's over earth and was freaked to see the reanactment clip had orange balls just like what i have seen. so even though this is a witness case i have no proof, no pictures and such that it could still be helpful in mapping where these different kind of sightings are happening.
content.summary: Orange ball of light

content.detailedDescription:
this is just what happened a couple hours ago. i took my dog out at 10:17pm, which was the time i seen on the kitchen clock when we went out the back door. beautiful night, temperature was 88 degrees, no wind, high overcast, but clearing. visibility was over 10 miles according to the local weather.

for some reason, my dog didn't want to come down the steps to where i was standing, and he usually can't wait to. he stood looking toward the west-northwest corner of my property instead. he wouldn't come down even when i called him. he just stood there staring.

i looked to see what the heck he was worried about, and saw what i at first thought was a plane approaching to land at phoenix-mesa gateway airport, which is northwest of me here, about 16 miles away. it was in the same area of the sky as where the regular flight path that planes use is.

it looked like a plane coming head-on at me with the white landing lights on. i couldn't see any faa lights on it, but thought that was maybe because the landing lights were so bright. then, as i was just about to lose interest and turn away, i could see that the light was becoming more and more orange-colored, and getting brighter. the more orange it got, the more oval-shaped it became, and the larger it seemed to be.

after this continued for about 10 seconds or so, it appeared to stop at the same height as, and right next to the top of the big hill in the desert about 4,000 feet west from my back door. it stopped growing larger, or closer, when it was about 75 feet wide, and seemed to hover next to the peak about 200 feet north of the hill.

i was confused, and continued to watch it as it sat still in the sky without a sound, for about 15 or 20 seconds. if it were a plane at that distance (4,000 feet), and at an altitude of roughly 350 feet, i should have for sure heard the sound of the engines. there was no noise whatsoever. no traffic way out here, all is pretty quiet.

suddenly, the oval shot sideways about 150 feet, flashed twice as it moved, and completely disappeared! it didn't accelerate away, it was just all of a sudden moving at a rapid speed to my right instantly.

as i stood there with my mouth hanging open, looking real hard to find any trace of it i could see, a very, very bright red light lit up at the peak of the hill that the oval was just next to. i focused my eyes on it, but couldn't tell if it was around the other side of the hill, or sitting there on the ground at the right side of a spot just below the rocky peak.

i could see it was a perfectly shaped ball of red light, and the lower left edge of it was hidden by part of the hill. the red light didn't reflect on the hillside, it seemed to be contained inside the ball somehow, but was still extremely bright anyway. it made me squint.

the red ball light didn't come on gradually, it just snapped on, stayed lit about 1 second, maybe a little bit longer, then snapped off. if it was on the side of the hill as it looked like it was, it had to have been about 30 feet in diameter. when the light went out, i couldn't see it against the dark hill, or the night sky.

i was trying to figure out what it was that i just saw when my dog came part way down the steps, looked in the direction of where the lights used to be a couple of times, then meandered off to do his job just like nothing happened.

that's what i saw, and i don't care who believes me and who doesn't because that don't change nothing about what happened. i been living here almost 10 years now, and seen probaly hundreds of planes coming in for a landing, and also some other strange lights in the desert, but this wasn't no plane or other lights like i've ever seen before. no way. what they were or where they went, i just don't have a clue.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: White light turned orange while approaching, hovered, then shot away. when gone, red sphere on or beyond hill lit up brightly, then went out.

content.detailedDescription:
August 21, 2011 - i was driving west along baur rd, headed toward us 290. as i was diving, looking south, over the horizon of cypress, tx directly south of me, i saw some lights that appeared to be headed ne kinda along 290 but with a more westerly trajectory. i thought it was a low flying plane coming from bush international airport as it originated in that general direction. as i got closer to 290 it looked like it had stopped though. i hit 290 and turned left back south along the 290 feeder. at this point the lights were about 100 yards west of the freeway and were no longer moving. it was a triangular pattern of 3 red-ish steady lights. at 1st i thought it was just some sort of a tower that only appeared to be moving because i was driving along a winding road. however, as i got closer there was absolutely no tower to be found and the lights were still just hovering there, at a pretty low altitude, under 1000feet. ide say a couple football fields up. i kept driving slowly past it, but once i was under it, my  car roof obstructed my view and it remained out of sight. i kept driving south about a minute before i came to the light at mason rd and was able to look back once more, but at that distance, through my tinted rear window, i could no longer see it. i thought it was all strange, but nothing crazy. then about a half hour later, a friend and i were sitting in an open area behind our neighborhood when i thought i saw something again. this time it was two lights, not the same as the triangle, just one white light each, obviously independent of each other, but working in tandem. they were off to the northwest up 290 from our location (tuckerton rd between queenston boulevard and barker-cypress, 77095). the lights were in about the same area i saw the triangle. we watched them for a while and i actually got some on video. they started way far apart, one east and one west, and then passed close together before moving up and down the west side of the freeway several times, almost making a complete circle, with our location oriented to the se of the center of this path. they were just sweeping back and forth over the whole area. they made several passes over about an hour and a half span (approximately 10:30 through midnight). when they got closer (almost directly overhead) we could hear them and determined they were just helicopters, so i cut the video. but both of us agreed they weren't normal sounding. they almost sounded more like a plane but i think its because they were military choppers, which i assume are much more powerful and different sounding than the conventional choppy helicopter noise you might think of. both helicopters were also completely black, strengthening my suspicion that they were military aircraft. several times these helicopters turned out their forward facing lights as they passed over residential areas. a third light was also seen farther nw that never got as close as the other two, but judging from its size, flight pattern/speed and single light, it was also a helicopter.

september 12, 2011 - i returned and drove the same path i took august 21st tonight around midnight, just to be sure it wasn't a tower or anything. the lights were no where to be found and there is nothing similar anywhere in the area.
content.summary: 3 circular amber lights in an evenly spaced triangular pattern

content.detailedDescription: We were house sitting on the north east side of tucson and a bright star was going very slowly straight up. i noticed it rising above reddington pass so i started filming it. check these out!
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Bright star going straight up again

content.detailedDescription:
In 1995-1996 i was working in the hayward california area at the time and had a habit of taking my afternoon breaks outdoors, weather permitting, where i would watch and try to identify aircraft coming and going at the nearby hayward airport.

the event happened one day as i was taking my customary afternoon break. the weather that day was sunny and clear, with some high clouds in the distance. as i watched the small civilian aircraft (i.E., cessnas, etc.) flying to and from the airport, i became aware of another craft that appeared to hover above/near the airport, roughly 1000 feet above the air traffic. it was cigar-shaped, so at first i thought it might be a blimp, but then i noticed that the afternoon sun would glint off of it every so often, as though it was highly polished. it was silver and highly reflective, like a shiny chrome car bumper. 

i then thought that maybe it was a helicopter, but realized it was too large and the wrong shape. on top of all that, the object seemed completely silent. about that time i called a co-worker to come outside to have a look, but before he came out the object suddenly shot straight up into the high clouds in a split second. 

i know what i saw was solid as it reflected sunlight. i am also very familiar with the flight characteristics of both fixed and rotary wing aircraft, as i am an faa-certified aircraft mechanic. i have seen fighter jets at airshows perform spectacular stunts, but i can tell you that what i saw that afternoon far exceeded the capabilities of any aircraft i have ever seen. this thing accelerated from zero to thousands of miles an hour in an instant, and it did so vertically from a hover.

I am making this report for my brother-in law who has no computer. on august 25th and 26th at approximately 5:30 am, my brother-in law, who was staying at a remote cabin just south of lisbon, ohio, was looking out of his bedroom window when he spotted a disk or oval shaped object moving slowly above the tree tops of the surrounding woods. the weather at the time was stormy, with thunder and lightning.
the object had a ring of bright, rapidly flashing, multi-colored lights(red, green, orange, yellow) as viewed from approximately a 45 degree angle. there was a round spot which protruded from the bottom center which emitted an extremely bright white light. it was more of a flood light than a spot light.
the object moved slowly and did not hover or stop. the sighting lasted approximately 1 minute and 45 seconds. it made no sound,  but there was thunder, so any sound might have been covered up.
the next morning at about 5:36, he saw the same object, but it was higher up and was flying a slightly different path than the morning before. it was extremely foggy but he could very easily see the bright white light at the bottom of the craft. this sighting lasted about 45 seconds. he did not make a size estimate because he could not tell how far away the object was in either case. he was very excited and did not want to take his eyes off the object. the object disappeared behind trees on both mornings.

sorry for any lack of detail. i am recounting details as told to me by my brother-in law.
content.summary: Disk or oval object with multi-colored flashing lights and bright white light on bottom

content.detailedDescription: I was driving west along ford ave. in wyandotte, mi on the night of september 11, 2011.  at approximately 8:30 pm, i witnessed an orange light ascend quickly from wsw, heading e toward windsor, on.  it seemed to change color only once, from orange to red, then back to orange.  the object did not resemble a plane.  i pulled off to the side of the road and got out of my car after it had passed overhead.  i turned around and watched as the object appeared to slowly hover about 80 degrees above the horizon, due east, then changed to a north/north-east heading. the sky was clear and the object appeared to be very high up, probably more than a few miles. it did not seem to make any sound and it still appeared to be increasing in altitude, like a rocket.  i watched it for about another minute and a half until it disappeared.  there was one other witness who rode by on a bicycle.  she said she though it was a plane that was on fire.
content.summary: Witnessed ascent of strange object.  it looked like a rocket had launched from western michigan.

content.detailedDescription: Walking down road in the evening, looked to the northern horizon and saw a blip of light. i stopped and watched it grew bigger. i could make out the details of the light pattern. i thought it was planes in formation but there was only a low constant hum.  it whent straight from north to south. i looked around and saw another man staring at it as i was. he later turned out to be a drifted down from ontario, says he sees stuff like that when he's out in the wilderness but never in cities or populated areas. we parted and i went home sand told my room mate he told me about this site and here i am!
content.summary: A triangle of about 8 yellow lights

content.detailedDescription: Na minha adolesc���ncia, tinha o costume de urinar em frente a um grande muro da garagem que havia em frente a casa em que eu morava. certa vez, ��� noite, fui urinar e olhei para o c���u e reparei um ponto vermelho distante que ficou parado por um curto tempo e depois, se deslocou muito r���pido para cima em linha reta e desapareceu na escurid���o. minha cidade ��� iluminada, sou l���cido e n���o havia como confundir o que vi com algo comum do meu dia a dia por outro, lado n���o digo que fora algo alien���gena, s��� sei que essa experi���ncia me acompanha at��� hoje na mem���ria.
content.summary: Objeto com forma de bola/lágrima vermelha um puco distante com deslocamento muito rápido pro alto

content.detailedDescription:
A group of us (6) were sitting on our friends back deck of their house listening to music, talking, and drinking.  i had been looking out and up at the sky the entire evening, when suddenly, two very bright lights appeared almost directly above us.  at first, it appeared as though someone may have been shining  a couple of very large spot lights up into the sky, but the trajectory would have required for them to be doing so from our position where we were sitting.  in addition, there was no light beam eminating from the ground, and, as i looked closer, the lights appeared to originate from above the clouds, not shining on to them from below.  the two seperate lights measured (best guess) about 20'across??  they lights sat stationary for a moment, then began to move in erratic directions across, back, forth zig zag, etc. all while staying directly over our head.  there was no soung apparent, nor smell, or any other indicators.  then one light disappeared for a moment, only to reappear furhter across the horizon.  it then disappeared from that spot and reappeared back above us.

this went on for about 5 minutes. then, just as quickly as they appeared they disappeared.  the more i thought about it, the more i realized these lights were certainly not emminating from the ground and their size, color, and movement was not normal.  i would love to know if anyone else reports this sighting as well.  the other thing is that even if it were spot lights, they would have to have been huge to create this, and they would have to have been right where we were on the ground.  also, why would they just show up at 12:30 in the morning...We were in a neighborhood and there are no businesses around that are/were utilizing those type of lights for they business promotion.
content.summary: Bright lights (2) seperate objects just behind cloud cover

content.detailedDescription: While observing the moon tonight i noticed a starlike light under the moon and off to its south east direction slightly above the tree line.  i was facing east in the direction of lake erie's western/southern bank. i observed a star like object that slowly began to ascend after a minute, and slowly ascended through a small wispy cloud and shortly after rising through the cloud the light disappeared. the sky was clear except for a few small whispy clouds. it appeared as though it left a trail as it ascended.
content.summary: Satr like object slowly ascends and disapears

content.detailedDescription: Orange/red/white almost like a fireball, slowly ascending until disappearing.  seemed to be just like a fireball but it was ascending.  three observers.
content.summary: Fireball like object slowly ascending in to space.  pulsating like flames

content.detailedDescription: On 09/10/11 @ 10:02 pm. pacific time, my wife, daughter and i were on our back patio visiting. my daughter asked, what are those lights on the mountain? we looked over to the mountain and saw 3 bright triangular gold/copper lights. the lights began to pulsate sequentially. within 3 minutes we saw smaller trail lights blinking in a straight line from each point of the triangle. we called out my mother and father from inside the house to witness this phenomenon. the triangular shape moved up and over the mountain, we then lost sight of the object. 1 1/2 hour later 2 bright white/red stationary lights appeared on the farthest mountain top. these lights were similar to one another and were distanced from each other. the light on the highest point of the mountain ejected 2 smaller red lights from the east and west side. the ejected red lights slowly moved away from each other and then out of site. all the while the 2 large lights remained. 1 hour later the 2 stationary lights began to blink from white to red, one would blink and the other would blink back, as if they were signaling each other. the signaling went on for 3 minutes and then one light was gone, 10 seconds later the other light vanished.
content.summary: 3 bright triangular gold/copper lights appeared on mountain. 2 bright white/red lights appeared on mountain top.

content.detailedDescription: I was stargazing outside of my house, which is 12 miles out of town. and then it appeared randomly out of the corner of my eye. it looked like a star, or a plane but it wasn't moving.  while i was watching it my heart started to hurt, and my chest felt as if i couldn't breathe i was staring at it for a really long time, after i felt fine. and i lost sight of the object after i glanced away to look at my cat, when i looked back..... it was gone. i ran inside and stayed there for the night.
content.shape: Circle,   Egg,   Fireball,   Flash,   Oval,   Sphere,   Star-like
content.summary: Too long to summarize.

content.detailedDescription:
I was driving to work. it was a beautiful, sunny summer afternoon. it was so nice out that day i had removed the t-top off my car. 

i was traveling west on rte. 374. as i got into the "dip" across from seine bay i looked over my left shoulder. it was then i saw the object that mystified me (then and now).  i remember thinking out loud "holy ���������t that's haley's comet". i could not believe my eyes. i pulled the car off the right side of the road and turned off the ignition.

as i inspected the object it became clear that what i was seeing was not the comet. first of all, it was far to large. from my vantage point, it looked about the same size as a basketball. behind it was what appeared to be the tail. which was very thick (broad), and about 8 to 10x  in length versus width. the head was silver in color and reflective.  

i remembered that haley's comet had been a bit of a disappointment to observers. it was barely visible to the naked eye at night. and what i was seeing was quite incredible. so that made me suspect. also, there was no visible movement or motion. as i watched the object stared to change it's shape, it's form. the object began to separate. what appeared to be the tail, or contrail separated. the contrail dissipated, or evaporated. leaving a large chrome ball (sphere). from my viewpoint it hovered there, staying static. the sphere did not move. 

i watched the object until about 2:35p.M. i had to leave or be late for work. as i drove off i noticed that the sphere remained stationary. no movement at all. when i arrived at work i contemplated reporting the sighting to public relations at plattsburgh air force base.  i told a few of my fellow officers about my experience. i received the standard ridicule. so that stopped me from reporting to anyone. well until now.

i fancy myself a bit of an aviation buff. i was a pilot. i have seen all different kinds of aircraft in various stages of flight. in daylight and darkness. on that day in 1986, i saw something that i could not identify. not then, not now. maybe one day i will know what it was. i go on hoping.
content.summary: Highly reflective chrome ball (sphere)

content.detailedDescription:
While delivering pizza in the rain near denton and geddies roads, i spotted a triangular craft flying low, slow and silent, hovering then heading west toward willow run airport   the triangle had bright white lights on the three corners and a reddish glow from the center of the bottom.  i could make out most of the outline against the clouds and it was not shaped like any aircraft i have seen.  i watched it as i drove into the neighborhood and as i pulled up to the house i was delivering to.  i went to grab my ipod to take a picture but when i turned around it was gone.

i brought it up to some open minded friends of mine and one of them stated that they have seen similar objects around the same area on different dates.
content.summary: Triangular craft w bright white lites on corners

content.detailedDescription:
My daughter and me were going out to grab some food around mid-night(maybe earlier) and while at a stop light i noticed a star that looked bigger than the rest. i told my daughter that must be a planet(it was hovering)it just appeared to be a star or planet sitting there and then it twinkled like crazy i said with excitement "wow look at that" and then it flashed red and back to white (it stayed white and flashing) and then it took off and eventually it moved at a great speed,changed direction with ease,no sound.I did notice it seem to have a luminous radiation around it.

in the beginning, as i was driving and watching the object i caught up to it and it slowly went right over my car and then it just took off. we followed as long as we could,but there was no keeping up with this thing at that point. it flew with great speed out of our field of vision near the restaurant we were heading to.

this happened in manchester,tn. i am very curious if anyone else seen this?

i have seen life flight (helicopter) many times in this area along with airplanes and it was not the same lights, nor did it move like any regular aircraft.
this light was one single flashing white light,nothing else was around it or moving. there was no tail or wings as with aircraft (that i could see),only a luminous radiation ball around it.
*my time could be slightly off,we were up gaming,got hungry and went out for a late night snack.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Unknown
content.summary: Manchester,tn looked like a star

content.detailedDescription:
At about 11pm, saturday, september 10, i saw several (maybe 10), fire/flame like objects in the sky. when i first noticed them, there were maybe 4 or 5, almost stationary. then i saw that they were moving, very slowly. more appeared. they would rise, one by one, from the ssw and move northward until they dissapated/faded. i live near a jrb and i can recognize jets, commercial planes, fireworks, blimps and weather balloons, day or night. these were none of those. 

the objects seemed to be about a quarter the size of the moon, but it was difficult to judge the true size or distance. they appeared much like actual flames in the sky, almost like the holiday lights covered by paper sacks people place along their sidewalks during the holidays. a neighbor a block away called me stating he saw them too. we can't seem to find any evidence anyone else saw these things! if anybody else saw this, please say something. it's frustrating and a little scary.

the neighbor and i took some pictures with our phones but, they don't seem tobe very good.
content.summary: Several

content.detailedDescription: While looking at stars we noticed a bright light that appeared to shimmer and looked to be different colors with the naked eye. when observed with a pair of 10 x 50 wide angle binoculars the object was clearly shining red,yellow,blue and green light. it was stationary in the sky but each time we went out it was in a different place. we watched the object from about 9p.M. until around 1a.M. we go outside to have a cigarette as we dont smoke in our home so we would look for it each time we went out. without a compas i can only estimate location but when we saw it was in the western,north western,northern and then again in the western sky. this was in a matter of about 4 or 5 hours and we never actually saw it moving.
content.summary: Starlike object in the sky which shimmered red,yellow,blue and green light. appeared stationary but appeared in different areas at different times

content.detailedDescription: My uncle nils paquette passed away and myself seen this too?Thanks flashlightcop
content.summary: Skylook12/73

content.detailedDescription: Just a short glimpse of it for a minute or so while i stepped out to check on our cows, and saw a white circle object that was heading west, before i could run and get my camcorder it was gone.
content.summary: Checking our cattle

content.detailedDescription:
I was driving in my car west on la hwy 82, just south/sse of milton, la.  it was about 7:20 pm local time and still light out since the sun had just set.  the skies were clear.  a nearly full moon was rising behind me in the east. 

after coming around a curve and away from houses and trees, i saw a triangular object hovering over a sugarcane field through the front windshield.  it looked less than 500 ft away and less than 10 degrees in height, so i got a good look at it.  it was definitely not a normal aircraft and all i could think of is its a ufo.  

the object was pewter colored or like the color of a silver dime but darker.  it was not very thick and there was a raised, triangle shaped area in the center on top like a cockpit.  it was mostly edge-on to me and i could only see one light at first on what looked like the front of the object.  it was only a second or two after first seeing it that the light brightened and the object suddenly spun around 180 degrees in place and stopped. i saw 2 more lights for a total of three as it spun. they were white and there was one at each tip of the triangular object and each were getting brighter.  it was like it was powering up and about ready to do something.  the next thing i knew the object disappeared, then it instantly reappeared a short distance away to my right and was hovering again.  

i tried reaching for my cell phone camera at that point and looked down to get it for just a moment.  when i looked up, the object was gone and i never saw it again.

a photoshopped image/drawing of the area is attached simulating the sky and object as it looked before i lost sight of it.
content.summary: Saw a triangular object hovering over field.   it spun around on its axis, stopped, disappeared, then instantly reappeared a short distance away.
